data.title: Fanny (Koch) Einstein (1852-1926)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Fanny (Koch) Einstein born 1852 Jebenhausen, Göppingen, Württemberg, Deutschland died 1926 Berlin, Germany including ancestors + descendants + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Fanny Einstein formerly Koch

Born 25 Feb 1852 in Jebenhausen, Göppingen, Württemberg, Deutschland

Ancestors

Sister of Jacob Nicholas Koch and Pauline (Koch) Einstein

Wife of Rudolf Einstein — married 1 Jun 1871 [location unknown]

Descendants

Died 10 Nov 1926 at age 74 in Berlin, Germany

Profile last modified 26 Mar 2024 | Created 9 Mar 2014

This page has been accessed 2,627 times.

Biography

Fanny (Koch) Einstein has Jewish Roots.

Fanny was born on 25 Feb 1852 in Jebenhausen. She was the daughter of Judas Koch and Jüttle Bernheimer.[1]

"Elsa, the daughter of Rudolf Einstein and Fanny Koch, was born in Hechingen (Schloßstraße 16) in January 1876. She had two sisters, Paula and Hermine. Rudolf Einstein was a textile manufacturer in Hechingen."[2]

Fanny passed away in 1926.[3]

Sources

↑ Geburtsregister Jebenhausen * 1845-1875, Personenstandsregister jüdischer Gemeinden in Württemberg, Baden und Hohenzollern (18. - 20. Jahrhundert), Hauptstaatsarchiv Stuttgart, J 386 Bü 298 p.41-42

↑ Hans-Josef Küpper. Einstein-website.de: Elsa Einstein (short biography).

↑ Find A Grave: Memorial #236911106

Wikidata: Item Q30302248

Wikipedia: Pauline Koch (Albert's mother) (Fanny's sister)

German Wikipedia article on Fanny's husband Rudolf Einstein

"Pedigree Resource File," database, FamilySearch (http://familysearch.org/pal:/MM9.2.1/93LB-6VM : accessed 2014-03-09), entry for Fanny Koch, submitted by aguggenheim2733156.
